SqliteDatabase

Manage a SQLite database.  This class implements all of the current DBD interface as defined in Database.  In addition, a few “extra” functions are included.

See Also

BaseDatabase, Database

Summary
SqliteDatabase
Manage a SQLite database.
Functions
connect
Connect to a database (open), create if necessary.
Above and Beyond DBI API
Functions
getTableNames
Get a list of all table names
getViewNames
Get a list of all view names
getIndexNames
Get a list of all index names
hasTable
Does this database have the given table?
hasView
Does this database have the given view?
hasIndex
Does this database have the given index?

Functions

connect

Connect to a database (open), create if necessary.

Paramenters

char[] dbFiledatabase filename to open or create
char[] usernot used
char[] passwdnot used

hasTable

Does this database have the given table?

Parameters

char[] namename of table to check for existance of

Returns

0does not have
1has

hasView

Does this database have the given view?

Parameters

char[] namename of view to check for existance of

Returns

0does not have
1has

Parameters

char[] namename of index to check for existance of

Returns

0does not have
1has
Database interface that all DBD’s must inherit from
Base Database implementation that is suggested that other DBD’s inherit from.
